FuncDef: The display bgp flow routing-table peer advertised-routes command displays BGP Flow Specification routes.
CLIs: display bgp flow routing-table peer <ipv4-address> advertised-routes <reindex>

ParaDef.Info:
Displays information about the route of a specified index.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Specifies an IPv4 address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Displays information about routes advertised to a specified peer.
-

Examples: BGP flow-ipv4 routing table entry information of 2:
AS-path Nil, origin igp, MED 0, pref-val 0, valid, local, best, pre 0
Not advertised to any peer yet
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To view information about BGP Flow Specification routes, run the display bgp flow routing-table peer advertised-routes command.
